I wonder if it is possible to build a decentralized alternative to https://t.co/u8D7Mv9cGK ‚Ä¶
I mean, how can we share structured data, attending info, CfP, news around conferences in a way that makes it easy to discover,
but does not depend on a central, commercial entity.

@helloanselm Yes, I was just wondering what tech would be available to achieve that, and if at all.
A better lanyrd is definitely an improvement.
@helloanselm I don't have much hope that they get it together.

I wrote a post about how to build a professional network if you are early in your career:
https://t.co/NXE1edra8i

@helloanselm Hm, this or https://t.co/5q0ka6Zmai are geared towards 1:1 relationships of content and authors.
Content curation is not solved there.
@helloanselm This needs a way to "announce" structured content, so it can be discovered by consumers.

@helloanselm We can describe content with https://t.co/SAdeUNvV3z
But I have yet to find something for the announcement part.

@helloanselm Yes, I thought about RSS. But you need to know the URL.
How do you find these URLs without Google?

@helloanselm Sure! 
To hell with it!
https://t.co/Fqo5u52HZx or similar "Gossip Networks" would work.
https://t.co/ECs0HZmzbD

Here is my #JavaScript üîß best practice tip of the day üìÜ:
Do not execute code in a module without being called.
Bootstrapping/configuring of modules must be done in one place üìç not all around the app üåê.

@dtanzer @allankellynet @jbrains @johanneslink @berndschiffer @NativeWired @ryyppy It makes sense to have it for products, but for consulting there are way to many factors to make that transparent. 
I would be careful with offering startup rebates. Not every startup needs c.

@dtanzer I personally never had the need to do it. And it worked very well because I did have projects w/ startups who paid me partially in IOUs. And contracts with companies for a way higher hourly rate.

@dtanzer Yes, it's a great way to work with startups. You don't reduce your hourly rate, or give a rebate. You just postpone the payment. If the startup is bankrupt, it's your loss. If they survive for 2 years, they had enough time to save for the money (or are hopefully successful).

@tpflug @benjamin I would love to attend, although I think the filter bubble factor would be very high there as well.

@benjamin @tpflug It will be valuable to exchange methods, experiences. But these are often workarounds and hacks for a broken system. And the ones responsible for these systems won't attend (CEOs, Owners, Investors).

@tpflug @benjamin Right. I'm certain that there is enough demand for a conference that focuses on these topics.

It might be that this is just what it needs to make many realize that it's the soft skills that make or break projects.

For me the sentiment of #paytospeak is that as a speaker, I should pay close attention how accessible it is for other speakers (especially of underrepresented groups, unexperienced, or low income) to be able to speak at a certain conference.
An important factor to this is also the economic goal of the conference. There are many great conference I'm going to which don't ask for insane ticket prices.

#PaytoSpeak also is about creating awareness that we limit diversity in speaker panels, because it's very easy to chip in the resources to speak at any given conf as  white male with high-income.

We are the easy choice for conference organizers. Think about this privilege!

Harrrrrrdware. Orrrr.
